alert.note: Alert for Barry; Lawrence; McDonald; Newton (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued May 18 at 3:03AM CDT until May 18 at 3:15AM CDT by NWS Springfield
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 315 AM CDT FOR SOUTHEASTERN NEWTON...NORTHERN MCDONALD...NORTHERN BARRY AND SOUTHEASTERN LAWRENCE COUNTIES... At 301 AM CDT, severe thunderstorm outflow winds were located along a line extending from near Mount Vernon to near Fairview to near Goodman, moving southeast at 45 mph. Tree damage has been reported with this line. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Law enforcement. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Monett... Aurora... Mount Vernon... Marionville... Pierce City... Goodman... Purdy... Wheaton... Verona... Butterfield... Fairview... Pioneer... Halltown... Freistatt... Stella... Hoberg... Chesapeake... Wheelerville... Mcdowell... Pleasant Ridge... This includes the following highways... Interstate 44 between mile markers 41 and 58. Interstate 49 between mile markers 9 and 15. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...OBSERVED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Wind damage with these storms will occur before any rain or lightning. Do not wait for the sound of thunder before taking cover. SEEK SHELTER IMMEDIATELY inside a sturdy structure and stay away from windows.
